title: Post Game Stats
body: I was playing a game today, and I realized that as a champion that offers lots of cc/engage, it would be an interesting to see post game how long you cc'ed enemy champs for.

replies.body: I want to be able to see how many fool ADCs i saved with heals/shields. The technology is clearly there, as it is used on phantom dancer (although it is not too accurate, it could be improved).

Phantom dancer knows because the damage reduction is done at the moment the damage hits them, while heals/shields are at a different time to the damage itself, so in theory it can't know if the shot actually would have killed them otherwise due to all sorts of buffs/debuffs/etc that couldve come into play.
Very easy. I can think of a functional algorithm that would be a good deal more accurate than phantom dancer at figuring out prevented damage over time.

But did you actually save their life, or did you just save someone from needing to use heal/barrier/exhaust/item active(s)?

I can imagine a world where a damage mitigated stat could be developed and be accurate, but lives saved is something I'm pretty sure I could reliably break in principle.
